repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - State Governance and Capacity
            Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the State Governance and
            Capacity Building Project for Nigeria were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            moderate; Bank performance was satisfactory and borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: support from key stakeholders needs to be
            nurtured during project design and supervision. Capacity
            building should be undertaken during the design phase, in
            the period between design and effectiveness, and throughout
            project implementation. There may have been room for greater
            synergies and improved efficiency if some project activities
            had been implemented in collaboration across the three
            participating states. Intensive supervision supported by
            adequate additional supervision budgets can turn around a
            project. A focused piecemeal approach to human resource
            management is likely to be more successful than broad-based
            and ambitious reforms. Intensive project implementation
            facilitation and capacity building are needed if the World
            Bank is to assist in the modernization of the judiciary in
            Nigeria. Political economy considerations have to be
            understood and taken into account when designing and
            implementing integrated financial management information systems.

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - State Governance and Capacity
            Building Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the State Governance
            and Capacity Building Project is to: strengthen capacity in
            the relevant participating states for: 1) multi-year fiscal
            planning, expenditure policy and budgeting; 2) timely
            auditing and reporting; 3) effective and transparent public
            procurement management; 4) transparency in personnel
            registry and payroll controls; 5) effective tax registration
            and assessment measures in Bauchi and Kaduna states; and 6)
            enhanced delivery of civil service training. This
            restructuring paper seeks approval for the extension of the
            closing date of the project, from March 31, 2011 to December
            31, 2011. If this request for extension is granted, it will
            be the second extension of the project and amount to a
            cumulative extension of 21 months. The first extension was
            approved in October 2009 for a period of 12 months, from
            March 31, 2010 to March 31, 2011. This extension is
            necessary to enable Kaduna and Bauchi States to complete the
            implementation of Budget and Treasury Management Information
            System (BATMIS) contracts signed in October and December
            2010 respectively.

Nigeria - State Governance and Capacity
            Building Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the State Governance
            and Capacity Building Project in Nigeria is to strengthen
            the capacity and quality of the public financial and
            procurement management systems personnel and payroll
            management system and monitoring and evaluation system. The
            restructuring is in response to the request from the
            Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria. The
            restructuring is intended to achieve the following: (a) to
            ensure the efficient utilization of resources by
            re-allocating undisbursed funds under National Project
            Coordination Unit (NPCU) to states, where resources are
            needed under the various expenditure categories; and (b) to
            simplify and build in some flexibility in the disbursement
            arrangement by pooling all undisbursed funds under a single
            disbursement category in each state.

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - State Governance Work Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the State Governance
            Work Project in Nigeria is to strengthen the capacity and
            quality of the public financial and procurement management
            systems personnel and payroll management system and
            monitoring and evaluation system. Some of the negative
            impacts of the project are: disposal of construction and
            demolition waste on roadsides, noise pollution nearby
            schools and colleges, air pollution, deterioration of soil
            characteristic due to increased erosion, water pollution,
            impacts on vegetations, wildlife impacted through direct
            loss, loss of movement corridors, and indirectly through
            introduction of noise and pollutants, risk of road accident
            during constructions, and solid/hazardous wastes management.
            Mitigation measures of the project are: 1) regular
            collection and evacuation of work site refuse towards
            authorized dumps; 2) involvement of the Local Government
            Authorities and Communities in the election of discharge
            sites; 3) installation of sound insulation; 4) introduction
            of dust reduction measures in construction sites; 5)
            appropriate containment measures for all operational areas
            and proper disposal of used lubricants; 6) soil erosion
            control measures (e.g. reforestation, reseeding of grasses,
            land preparation, terracing etc); 7) forests and cultural
            heritage sites protection enforced; 8) preservation,
            restoration, and enhancement of existing wetland; 9)
            sensitive and critical habitats avoided; and 10) farmland
            and grazing areas should be relocated to other areas, if
            possible avoid farmlands and grazing areas.
